---
title: "launch.json"
---

## High-level description
This file is a Visual Studio Code (VS Code) launch configuration file. It defines a debug configuration for running the Elementary Data Reliability (EDR) CLI tool within VS Code's integrated debugger.

## Symbols

### Launch Configuration
#### Description
The launch configuration, named "edr", is set up to debug a Python module using the `debugpy` debugger. It specifically targets the Elementary CLI module and allows for dynamic argument selection.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| name | string | The name of the debug configuration |
| type | string | The type of debugger to use |
| request | string | The type of debug session to start |
| module | string | The Python module to run |
| console | string | The console to use for output |
| args | string | The command to execute for selecting arguments |

#### Internal Logic
The configuration is set up to:
1. Use the `debugpy` debugger, which is specific to Python.
2. Launch the `elementary.cli.cli` module.
3. Use the integrated terminal for console output.
4. Dynamically pick arguments using a VS Code command.

## Dependencies
| Dependency | Purpose |
|:-----------|:--------|
| debugpy | Python debugger used for debugging the Elementary CLI |

## Configuration
| Option | Type | Default | Description |
|:-------|:-----|:--------|:------------|
| version | string | "0.2.0" | The version of the launch configuration format |

## API/Interface Reference
| Command | Description |
|:--------|:------------|
| ${command:pickArgs} | A VS Code command that allows the user to select arguments dynamically when launching the debugger |

This launch configuration provides a convenient way for developers to debug the Elementary Data Reliability CLI directly within VS Code, with the ability to dynamically select arguments for each debug session.
